alert.note: Alert for Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 01 at 2:48PM EDT until May 03 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: .Snow is expected tonight through Wednesday. Wet snow combined with gusty winds will put stress on trees that have already developed leaves. Power outages may result. Snow accumulations will primarily occur overnight with melting during the daytime hours, and will be largely elevation dependent. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches, with 8 to 12 inches possible in the highest elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages. Freezing temperatures may pose threats to sensitive vegetation and exposed outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
